title: [$250] Tax - Tax name is missing and tax is no longer selected after changing tax code

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjoisjdosnijjsondijdso@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Taxes are enabled. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense with 0% tax rate. 4. Create another expense with 5% tax rate. 5. Open any expense. 6. Click Tax field. → Tax field show tax rate name and it is selected in the list. 7. Go to workspace settings > Taxes. 8. Click 0% rate > Tax code. 9. Upgrade the workspace. 10. Edit tax code and save it. 11. Repeat Step 8 and 10 with 5% rate. 12. Open any expense from Step 3 or 4. 13. Click Tax field. → Tax field is not showing tax rate name. Tax is no longer selected in the list. 14. Go back to expense report. 15. Select both expenses via checkbox > click dropdown button > Merge. → Tax rate section is also missing tax rate name and it is showing only tax percentage. ## Expected Result: In Step 13 and 15, after editing tax code, Tax name will not disappear and tax will remain selected. ## Actual Result: After changing tax code, - in Step 13, Tax field is not showing tax rate name. Tax is no longer selected in the list. - in Step 15, Tax rate section is also missing tax rate name and it is showing only tax percentage. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/68a79142-7675-499a-b232-41e38c2db3c7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

  • Upwork Job ID: 2024978932059523878
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-20

title: [$250] Missing Tax rate section when merging expenses when expenses are created without Tax first

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** soidjnsoidjonjonjsojnsdj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a workspace. 3. Go to workspace chat. 4. Create two expenses. 5. Go to workspace settings > More features. 6. Enable Taxes. 7. Open one of the expenses from Step 4. 8. Click Tax and select 5% rate. 9. Click More > Merge. 10. Select the other expense from Step 4 > Continue. → Tax rate section is missing. 11. Close the merge flow. 12. Open the other expense (not the 5% tax rate expense). 13. Click Tax and select 5% rate. 14. Click Tax and change back to 0% rate. 15. Open the 5% tax rate expense. 16. Click More > Merge. 17. Select the 0% tax rate expense from Step 4 > Continue. → Now Tax rate section is shown. ## Expected Result: In Step 10, Tax rate section should be shown because both expenses have different tax rates. ## Actual Result: In Step 10, Tax rate section is missing when both expenses have different tax rates. In Step 17, Tax rate section is only shown after changing tax rate and reselecting 0% rate. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/26b2b45e-e97a-4908-80ea-052605ba69d7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. Prerequisite 2: Have at least two different tax rates that are not the default one. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create two manual expenses with different tax rates that are not the default one. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 5. Select one of the expenses. 6. Click on dropdown menu and select "Merge" 7. Select the second expense. 8. Keep amount and tax from the second expense. 9. Note that when landing on "Expenses" again, a "Tax rate was modified" error appears on preview. 10. Navigate to chat. 11. Note that no RBR is visible and no error is displayed on expense preview. 12. Return to "Reports" > "Expenses" 13. Open the expense. 14. Note that no error is visible inside report. 15. Return to "Expenses" 16. Note that error disappears. ## Expected Result: No error should appear after merging expenses with different tax rates. ## Actual Result: "Tax rate was modified" error message appears on expense preview after merging two expenses with different tax rate on "Expenses" section. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/72c50ef4-4848-48bb-b4cb-a53606c9ae3a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1-staging **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Preconditions: The user has 2 workspaces. Workspace 1 has tax enabled, with at least 1 tax rate. Workspace 2 has tax disabled. 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Create 1 expense in Workspace 1 with a tax rate (value higher than %0) 3. Rename the report 4. Create 1 expense in Workspace 2 5. Open the expense from Workspace 2, then go to More > Merge 6. Select the expense from Workspace 1 7. Select the report from Workspace 1 (the renamed one) and fill in the other details with any options ## Expected Result: When merging expenses, the system should respect the tax enabled setting of the report. ## Actual Result: When merging an expense from a non tax enabled report with one from a tax enabled report, no tax is calculated. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b26b6d5-fa78-48b9-a32f-79c2645ed832 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (All the steps described, but the bug did not occur) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction (All the steps described, but the bug did not occur) **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Kaylee Rodriguez **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [expensify_bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771555528634549) ## Action Performed: 1. Click Add approval workflow and create the first approval workflow: Expenses from employee 1 > 2. First approver A > Second approver B 3. Click Add workflow 4. Click Add approval workflow and create the second approval workflow: Expenses from employee 2 > First approver A > Second approver B 5. Click Add workflow ## Expected Result: Once they click Add workflow, it should be added as a new workflow with no issues. The "submitter" shouldn't be added as a Second approver. ## Actual Result: After clicking Add workflow for the second one that is created, it doesn't create another workflow. Instead, employee 2 is added as a Second approver to the first workflow ## Workaround: Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround? ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos For the details check this [OP](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771555528634549) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.23-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-5888/folder/15397164/59683337/1202917053?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Honor x6b/ Android 14 **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Precondition: Use has workspace and created an Expense Report 1. Navigate to Report title 2. Enter formula: {report:created:hh}  3. Navigate to expense report and verify 12-hour format with leading zero (e.g., "03")  4. Enter formula: {report:created:HH}  5. Navigate to expense report and verify 24-hour format (e.g., "15")  Result: The zero format remains. 6. Open the expense details Result: 24 hours format is update ## Expected Result: The report title should update immediately after changing the formula, reflecting the correct time format (12-hour or 24-hour) without requiring the user to enter the report details. ## Actual Result: When switching between {report:created:hh} and {report:created:HH}, the report title does not update automatically. The format remains unchanged (either stays in 12-hour format with leading zero or remains in 24-hour format) until the user opens the report details. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/45b4fff2-6e43-4581-bd4f-1ee860dfd094 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to self DM. 3. Create a manual expense with 5% tax rate. 4. Create a manual expense with 10% tax rate. 5. Open the first expense from Step 3. 6. Click More > Merge. 7. Select the other expense from Step 4 > Continue. 8. In Step 8, Tax amount will be calculated based on the selected amount. ## Actual Result: In Step 7, There is no tax section to select when merging workspace expense with self DM expense. User A is configured to submit expenses to Approver B in the workflow 2. User A submits an expense report in New Expensify 3. The report is automatically routed to Approver C, without showing any option to select a different approver 4. When opening the same report in Expensify Classic: The report appears as “Outstanding”, waiting for second approver approval 5. There is also an “Add Expenses” button visible ## Expected Result: The report should route to the approver configured in the workflow (Approver B). Once submitted and pending approval: The report should not allow adding expenses (if submission locks the report per workflow). Report state should be consistent between New Expensify and Classic. ## Actual Result: The report routes to Approver C instead of the configured approver. No option is presented to select or override approver. In Classic: Report shows as “Outstanding” (awaiting second approval). “Add Expenses” button is still available despite submission. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshots and video for the issue are in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771592738132239) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] [BATCH 1] Migrate ConfirmModals & ReanimatedModals

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Modal After Transition Refer to [README.md](../../INTERACTION_MANAGER.md) for more information what's the overall strategy and why we're migrating away from `InteractionManager.runAfterInteractions`. ## Strategy **Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook** The `showConfirmModal` function returned by `useConfirmModal` returns a Promise that resolves **after the modal close transition completes** (the underlying `closeModal` is called inside `onModalHide`, which fires after the animation finishes). This means any code that `await`s the result already runs post-transition — no explicit `afterTransition` callback is needed. ```typescript const {showConfirmModal} = useConfirmModal(); const {action} = await showConfirmModal({ title: 'Delete items?', prompt: 'This cannot be undone.', confirmText: 'Delete', danger: true, }); if (action !== ModalActions.CONFIRM) { return; } // This runs after the modal close transition — cleanup here setSelectedItems([]); deleteItems(); ``` Instead of: ``` setModalVisible(false); InteractionManager.runAfterInteractions(() => { // cleanup here }); ``` For **ReanimatedModal** usages, use ref pattern (ref.current.open({afterTransition: callback})) with `afterTransition` to defer work until after the modal close animation ## 1. ConfirmModal Pattern (migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook) Nearly all workspace pages follow the same pattern: user confirms an action via a modal, then selections are cleared after the modal closes. Migrate from inline `` component + `InteractionManager` to the `useConfirmModal` hook, whose promise resolves after the close transition. | File | Line | Current | Migration | PR | | ----------------------------------------- | ---- | ----------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- | | `WorkspaceMembersPage.tsx` | 272 | `setSelectedEmployees([])` + remove | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#54178](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54178) | | `ReportParticipantsPage.tsx` | 251 | `setSelectedMembers([])` | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#50488](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/50488) | | `ReportParticipantsPage.tsx` | 446 | Same pattern | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#50488](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/50488) | | `RoomMembersPage.tsx` | 155 | `setSelectedMembers([])` | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#50488](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/50488) | | `WorkspaceCategoriesPage.tsx` | 346 | Category bulk action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#60023](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/60023) | | `WorkspaceCategoriesSettingsPage.tsx` | 346 | Category settings cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#56792](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/56792) | | `WorkspaceTagsPage.tsx` | 437 | Tag bulk action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#60023](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/60023) | | `WorkspaceViewTagsPage.tsx` | 221 | Tag view action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#82523](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82523) | | `WorkspaceTaxesPage.tsx` | 250 | Tax bulk action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#60023](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/60023) | | `PolicyDistanceRatesPage.tsx` | 317 | Distance rate action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#60023](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/60023) | | `WorkspacePerDiemPage.tsx` | 267 | Per diem action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#60023](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/60023) | | `ReportFieldsListValuesPage.tsx` | 195 | Report fields cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#60023](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/60023) | | `WorkspaceExpensifyCardDetailsPage.tsx` | 94 | Card details cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#74530](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/74530) | | `WorkspaceCompanyCardsSettingsPage.tsx` | 88 | Card settings cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#57373](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/57373) | | `WorkspaceWorkflowsPage.tsx` | 141 | Workflows action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#56932](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/56932) | | `WorkspaceWorkflowsApprovalsEditPage.tsx` | 59 | Approvals edit cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#52163](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/52163) | | `WorkspaceWorkflowsApprovalsEditPage.tsx` | 73 | Approvals edit cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#48618](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/48618) | | `WorkspacesListPage.tsx` | 639 | Workspaces list action cleanup | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#69146](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69146) | | `PopoverReportActionContextMenu.tsx` | 374 | `deleteReportComment()` after confirm | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#66791](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/66791) | | `AutoSubmitModal.tsx` | 43 | `dismissASAPSubmitExplanation()` on modal close | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#63893](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/63893) | | `useFilesValidation.tsx` | 108 | InteractionManager deferring file validation | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#65316](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/65316) | | `useFilesValidation.tsx` | 365 | InteractionManager deferring file validation | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#65316](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/65316) | | `ContactMethodDetailsPage.tsx` | 130 | Open delete modal after keyboard dismiss | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#35305](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/35305) | | `IOURequestStepMerchant.tsx` | 181 | Merchant submit + keyboard dismiss | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#67010](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/67010) | | `IOURequestStepDescription.tsx` | 226 | Description submit + keyboard dismiss | Migrate to `useConfirmModal` hook | [#67010](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/67010) | ## 2. ReanimatedModal Pattern (afterTransition callback) These usages involve ReanimatedModal's ref pattern to defer work until after the modal close animation. | File | Line | Current | Migration | PR | | ------------------------------------- | ---- | --------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- | | `FeatureTrainingModal.tsx` | 224 | `setIsModalVisible` based on disabled state | Use ReanimatedModal ref approach with afterTransition | [#57649](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/57649) | | `FeatureTrainingModal.tsx` | 352 | goBack + onClose after setting invisible | Use ReanimatedModal ref approach with afterTransition | [#53225](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/53225) | | `AvatarCropModal/AvatarCropModal.tsx` | 324 | InteractionManager deferring onClose | Use ReanimatedModal ref approach with afterTransition | [#66890](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/66890) | | `AttachmentModalHandler/index.ios.ts` | 12 | iOS: execute close callback after interaction | Use ReanimatedModal ref approach with afterTransition | [#53108](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/53108) |

title: [$250] Narrow React Compiler dependencies in MoneyRequestReportNavigation

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from a proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771578295267569) ### Background: When a user opens an Expense Report from Search results, the app renders MoneyRequestReportNavigation — the component responsible for prev/next navigation between reports. This component subscribes to 8 Onyx stores via useOnyx hooks. On every render, it calls getSections() + getSortedSections() — a chain that iterates all search result data, builds report action lookup maps, extracts violations, resolves transactions per report, runs policy/payment/approval checks per entry, then sorts everything. The component re-renders on every Onyx store update, including updates unrelated to the search data. ### Problem: When a user navigates from Search results to an Expense Report, every Onyx store update re-triggers the full getSections computation chain on all re-renders, even when the search data hasn't changed, blocking the JS thread with redundant work during navigation. ### Solution: Extract the specific sub-fields needed by getSections into separate variables before the computation block. This narrows the React Compiler's dependency tracking from whole objects to individual fields, so the cache only invalidates when the actual inputs change. Expected Outcome: flow:  create expense fab → add amount → add merchant → create expense → navigate to reports - Reduce re-renders 265 to 249 (-16), render time across all components from ~5,157ms to ~4,178ms (-19%) - ManualOpenCreateExpense span reduced 479 ms->337 ms (-30%) Draft PR -> https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82785
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @bernhardoj

  • Upwork Job ID: 2024854081531117550

title: [$250] Eliminate redundant sorting in LHN renderItem

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771486725240319) ### Background: The LHN renders a scrollable list of all user-visible reports via a FlashList renderItem callback. For each report row, renderItem derives several values from that report's actions: the last visible action, the last displayable action, the one-transaction thread report ID, and the last IOU money request action. Report actions are stored as unsorted objects in Onyx. A collection-level Onyx callback on ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_ACTIONS already fires on every data change and iterates over all report-action collections to maintain pre-computed caches (allSortedReportActions, lastReportActions, lastVisibleReportActions). Additionally, the reportAttributes OnyxDerived config already computes per-report metadata reactively whenever its Onyx dependencies change. ### Problem: When the LHN re-renders on a heavy account, each renderItem call independently performs two sort operations, a filter pass, and a find scan over that report's actions, which slows down initial navigation to the inbox and degrades scroll frame rates as the number of reports grows ### Solution: 1. Expose oneTransactionThreadReportID through the existing reportAttributes OnyxDerived config which already computes it but was discarding it so renderItem reads it reactively instead of calling getOneTransactionThreadReportID() per item. 2. Merge the .filter() and .find() passes in the REPORT_ACTIONS collection callback into a single for loop with early break, caching results in lastVisibleReportActions and lastVisibleIOUMoneyActions. 3. Replace the two per-item sort calls with a single-pass findLastReportActions() using an isNewerReportAction comparator, reducing per-item complexity [Draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82648) Performance gain: ManualNavigateToInboxTab span reduced ~30ms
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @sobitneupane
